Authors:

Zhang
Title:
Cytospora palm, a novel canker agent in Cotinus coggygria
evidenced by phylogenetic and morphological data
Abstract:
Cytospora palm sp. nov. is described on Cotinus coggygria
(Anacardiaceae) in China, on the basis of collections of morphological,
ITS and Ef1-a sequences data. Its key diagnostic characters are
gregarious, circular, erumpent conidiomata, locules of a rosette
cytosporoid type, with invaginations and 7-10 irregularly disposed
chambers sharing common walls, emerging beaks, and conidia 4-4.7Ã1-1.5
Î¼m. The optimum temperature for growth and sporulation is approximately
32 â.
